Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Bosphorus view in Sultanahmet at moderate price”
Reviews.Author: Konstantin_Kravtsov
Reviews.Content: This family owned hotel with 17 rooms is a good choice for budget stay in Sultahmet. It offers not only view to Bosphorus from street view rooms on 3rd and 4th floors, but also a two levels roof terrace with an extraordinary view to Bosphorus, Marmara sea, Hagia Sophia / Ayasofia and Sultan Ahmed Mosque (Blue Mosque). We enjoyed having early breakfast or late dinner there sightseeing the heart of Istanbul. The rooms are mediocre, not new, but clean, air conditioned and Turkish styled. Turkish breakfast is served on the roof terrace daily. Recommended for budget stay with Bosphorus view.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaPeter
Reviews.Content: This place was a treasure and we recommend it highly. Perfect location for seeing all of the Old City, as well as for heading across the Bosphorus or the Golden Horn. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. For example, the owner spent much time on the phone helping me arrange vaarious matters, which I couldn't have done as I don't speak Turkish. Hotel could be difficult to find but the owner had emailed us excellent instructions. The concierge is attentive to every detail re: breakfast preferences. When we reported a problem with our toilet seat it was fixed immediately. Note the coffeemaker and coffee provided in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located hotel, with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: happytravellerVanc
Reviews.Content: This hotel overlooks the water and from the roof top dining room the Blue Mosque. It is less than 5 minutes away from all of the major sites in the Old Town and from the tram to take you to the Bosphorus tours and spice market. There are many street side restaurants in the area and the staff at the hotel are only too happy to recommend one to you. The only issue is you have to be able to do stairs as there is no elevator, but not a problem for anyone who is not handicapped.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly/Comfortable/Affordable - GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: misskitty50
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be EVERYTHING one would want in a hotel. It is PERFECTLY located in the Old City for touring the major cultural sites and close to transportation (train station and tram stop) for getting to other sites/locations. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and were responsive to any need/request. The rooms are smaller, but certainly adequate (larger than some other hotel rooms in the area) and exceptionally clean and comfortable. Certainly, try to get a room facing the sea view.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ChristianFamily
Reviews.Content: GA 9 reviews Cosmopolitan Park Hotel Great location: 2 minute walk around the block to Hagia Sophia and the palace Exceptional service: the staff are gentlemen Spectacular views: the dining area and rooftop offer breathtaking views Nice rooms: sea side and upper floor rooms (e.g. 403) may be better Good breakfast: fresh fruits, breads, cheeses, and meat plus coffee and tea No smoking: entirely smoke free for no musty smell Value priced: fairly priced and available cash discount I had the pleasure of staying at the Cosmopolitan Park Hotel during a recent trip to Turkey. I'd researched the hundreds of hotel options in the historic section of Sultanahmet, Istanbul. There were no compelling options that weren't above my price range. After revising my search parameters to include non-smoking rooms the Cosmopolitan Park Hotel appeared as one of he few hotels that is entirely smoke free. That ended up my deciding factor and I couldn't be more happy with the decision. The Cosmopolitan Park Hotel will give you the taste of traditional Turkish accommodations. No the rooms aren't huge, they are adequate. But the beds are extremely comfortable and the AC cold when needed. No the bathroom doesn't have a jacuzzi tub, but they are big enough with hot water and strong water pressure. No there's no elevator/lift, but we could all use the exercise and if you want fancy, go to he Four Seasons. I can't say enough about the staff. Mr. Kamil was very prompt in responding to my every email and scheduling transportation for us. Mr. Fehme was there to carry bags up and down, had breakfast with hot tea and coffee for us each morning, all with a wonderful smile. Both offered trustworthy recommendations for site seeing and restaurants (the Meat House around the corner was our best meal of all). These gentlemen make it easy for me to recommend the Cosmopolitan Park Hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul. John 20:31 Georgia, USA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for discovering Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MosseTurku
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of the many small cosy hotels in the Sultanahmet-area of Istanbul. It's perfectly within walking distance to all the major cultural sites of Istanbul, yet in a more peaceful side street away from the nosy bars and restaurants. The rooms are small, but clean and freshly decorated. The rooms with sea view are slightly more expensive, but might be worth the extra cost. However, you can whenever climb up to the roof terrace and enjoy the sun and the fantastic view of the whole city. breakfast is served on the top floor and you can decide whether you enjoy it indoor or climb all the way to the roof. They don't serve anything else then breakfast, which means that the dininghall and rooftop is freely in your use the rest of the day. We bought every night some beer in the reseption and enjoyed it on the terrace. Needs of course some climbing and the hotel can not be recommended to disable people as there's no lift in the building. The hotel staff was great and you felt welcome all the time and it gave sort of a family feeling to the whole place.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: vitaestdecorus13
Reviews.Content: I stayed, with my daughter, at this hotel in summer 2010. It was a happy stay. This is a budget hotel at great location with a very good breakfast, with a helpfull and friendly staff. Comparing to other budget hotels in same area, pricing was reasonable. Our room was not big, had a tiny balcony+a small fridge+Tv. The bathroom needs some attention. The hotel is close to everything/Sultanahmet area and all sightseeings. Breakfast is served at the top floor room with a lovely view to Marmara sea. Fehmi is one of the staff who makes you feel you like at home. Thank you Kamil and Fehmi. We'll come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lilly062
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel but the location is superb and the staff and management are very helpful and friendly. It is clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a major rip-off”
Reviews.Author: blagovitz
Reviews.Content: This place was a real gouge - and like much of Istanbul, way over-priced. We expected much better value given the exhorbitant 70 euro/ night price for our room - and this was the best deal we could get even for a 5 night stay! Our room was the size of a large closet - only one of us could move in the room at any given time. Furthermore, there was no natural light entering the room, since the only "window" faced into some sort of grotty well that ran the length of the building. This well was also the source of much noise eminating from the other rooms at all hours. There was also drainage noises coming from our bathroom and the stink of sewage seeped into our room frequently. After our first (and only) experience with the pathetic breakfast at this hotel, we decided that our stomachs warranted much better and had breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, good location and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AlisonJW
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I wanted somewhere that was reasonably priced, well located for the main sights, and with good views. I can't fault it on any of those counts (though prices have increased since we booked!). The location is very close to the Blue Mosque, in a road of shops, hotels and hostels, and although some reviewers have mentioned that it is backpacker territory and a bit scruffy in parts, The Four Seasons Hotel is also situated here. The views from the roof top terrace are probably as good as you get from any hotel in the city - just a pity it rained a lot while we were there! And we paid extra for a sea view which I think was defninltely worth it; I liked waking up to the sounds and sights of seagulls and fishing boats. Yes, you do have to ignore a few scruffy roof tops between hotel and sea but the hotel can't do much about those. The room itself was bright, comfortable and nicely decorated with Turkish textiles. There was a small crack in the handbasin, and the room had rather a chemically smell (mothballs?) but neither of those things particulary bothered us. The rest of the hotel was simply and pleasantly decorated, and the staff - we only saw 2 in 5 days/nights! - were really freindly and helpful. Breakfast was good, as long as you're not expecting croissants or a hot meal , and it was nice to have a coffee maker - and coffee - provided in the room. If I go back to Istanbul I will defnitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful place to stay with a short walk to restaurants and sites”
Reviews.Author: dkuhlman
Reviews.Content: An excellent room. The whole place was clean and pleasant. The lobby was attractive and comfortable. And, the terrace where we ate breakfast had great views. And the breakfast was very good. The staff was helpful and pleasant. And, Kamil, who runs the front desk, is a treasure. Be sure to spend some time talking with him about Turkey, its politics, its literature, etc. The location is very near the Topkapi Palace, the Hagia Sophia, and the Blue Mosque. We reserved and got a room with a "Double room with a sea view", which I can recommend. It was a very pleasant room with a small table, several chairs, and a large window with view. There might be other rooms that are not quite as pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for mediocre quality”
Reviews.Author: skyguyWI
Reviews.Content: I chose the Cosmopolitan Park Hotel based on all of the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor. When I arrived, I was quite disappointed. At 66â‚¬ (USD88) per night, it was very much overpriced. The hotel is located on a quiet side street in Sultanahmet with hostels and guesthouses as neighbors. The Cosmopolitan Park Hotel seemed more like a hostel than a hotel. The first thing I noticed was that there was no lift. Although someone from the hotel carried our luggage up the two flights of stairs on arrival, we had to do the reverse on our own at departure. For people traveling with more than the rollaboard bag I had, that would be a big inconvenience. The room was small but clean. In the bathroom, my friend and I discovered that the toilet seat was not securely attached to the toilet. We also found that one of the two shower doors was broken, so it would not stay on its track. I expected it to fall on me while I was taking a shower. The "land side" room had no view whatsoever. We overlooked a trash strewn roof and run down buildings. The breakfast was very, very limited. On the one morning I actually had the breakfast, my choices were limited to not much more than some olives, bread, watermelon, and a juice box. Based on other, European hotels I've stayed at in this price range, the Cosmopolitan Park Hotel is overpriced and not worthy of the rave reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended: brilliant views, very clean rooms and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Tony201020
Reviews.Content: This small, friendly hotel is perfectly located: very short walking distance from Aya Sofiya, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and many other sights. The rooms, though on the small side, are very clean and the seaside rooms have breathtaking views - well worth the extra. Breakfasts, served on the rooftop terrace, are generous and fresh. We stayed at this hotel for about a week and invariably experienced really good service both at reception and breakfast and lots of help when airport closures threatened to delay our return. Excellent value: we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery, very friendly staff, a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: EricDeCastro
Reviews.Content: Cosmopolitan Park Hotel is steps away from the Blue Mosque. The views on the roof terrace are breathtaking. You have a view of both the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia as well as an unobstructed view of the Sea of Marmara. Me and my fiance chose the Sea View Room and asked to be on the 3rd floor - it was perfect and clean. Waking up to the sun and sea is always calming. Be forewarned, there are no elevators should you ask for the same. The room wasn't spacious but it was only for a party of two, not a problem. A bigger party would have to book multiple rooms to avoid disappointment. Mr. Kamil was very nice and very helpful whenever help was needed. Mr. Fehmi was also very nice and helpful, he normally served breakfast. The cleaning lady we didn't speak to much, but she did the job. You can hear neighbors through the walls. Also, if you plan on staying in Sultanahmet or any place near a Mosque be prepared for the frequent calls to prayer. Overall, the beauty of the hotel lies in it's simplicity, privacy, and relaxed setting. It is as if you're staying at a relative's or friend's house. Have a nice, unpretentious chat with the guests and staff. Enjoy your stay as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, great roof terrace and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SousLes0liviers
Reviews.Content: Great place. Very conveniently located in Sultanhamet between blue mosque and Saint Sophia. It has the second best roof terrace in that area, just after the four seasons. Just because this building is one floor higher than the other ones. So lucky you, you get that amazing view on both both the sea and the old district of Sultanhamet. I liked the staff too, esp at the counter downstairs. Very helpful. Doesnt try to sell anything. Just to help you. He (the owner) recommends for example the public company for a boat trip on Bosphore. And that was a great advice. The room was clean, and cleaned every day. The breakfast was a buffet. So you can get as much as you want. Good quality food. Free wifi. And the room was fairly cheap compared to other places there. We (my girlfriend and I) recommend that place, and we'd go back there if back in Istanbul. (we spent 2 weeks in Turquey end of sept/beg of Oct). One thing : be careful with the taxis in Istanbul, they are just going to rip you off. At least they did rip us off for the few times we used them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice hotel, but weirdly empty”
Reviews.Author: sportcoat
Reviews.Content: We needed a place in Sultanahmet for 5 nights, and it seemed like every place was booked. Every place but this one. Our whole time here, we didn't see another soul except one night. During the day, all the doors to the rooms were open. Breakfast on the roof (which has one, two, three! separate terraces and spectacular views) was there just for us... There's nothing wrong with this, but it just felt a little strange. Clean rooms, nice people, a bar upstairs that would probably be open if more than 2 guests were staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0409
Reviews.Content: We (my wife, our 10 year old son and I) stayed at Cosmopolitan Park Hotel from April 26 through May 4. This was our first tvisit to Istanbul and we were on a business trip. Cosmopolitan Park Hotel met our expectations and we definitely plan on returning to this hotel when we visit Istanbul next. Mr. Kamil is a delightful host! He is ever helpful and makes himself available at all times (for example, we had to catch an early morning flight to Ephesus which meant our leaving at 5.30am from the hotel and he was there to assist us). The staff, Mr. Kazim and Ms. Esvet, are nice and welcoming. They too go out of their way to be helpful and offer their services with a smile! Our son greatly enjoyed their attention and company, and we immensely appreciated their thoughtful help as and when needed. There are a number of things we liked about the hotel... Location: It is just a block and a half from the Arasta Bazaar and very close to (less than 10 minutes walk) to the Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, the commuter train station, the tram station, eateries, travel agencies, etc.). Restaurant and terrace: The hotel has an enclosed restaurant on the fourth floor with stunning views of the Sea of Marmara. Breakfast is served there daily (8.00am to 10.30am) and one can enjoy the passing boats, ferries, and ships. Seagulls come closer and add to the scenery. The open terrace on the fifth floor offers an even better view of the surroundings and one could sit there for hours with a novel taking in the beautiful sights (particularly the Blue Mosque) all around. The restaurant has a bar, but we did not use the services. WiFi: The hotel has WiFi available at all levels. While the strength of the signal is variable, the availability of WiFi makes communication simpler and 24/7. Breakfast: Breakfast is included in the price and includes hard boiled eggs, fresh cut cucumbers and tomatoes, cold cuts, corn flakes, cheese, black olives, green olives, yogurt, fresh bread rolls, etc. Beverages include regular coffee, regular tea, juice (in boxes) and water (in boxes). Breakfast is sumptuous. but does not vary on a daily basis. Hot water: Hot water is available 24/7 and the temperature is comfortable. Heat: The radiant heat is controlled by a central thermostat and offered comfortable heat at night when the temperature dropped quite a bit. Security: The rooms (we stayed in two different rooms--one with a view of the Sea and another without) have good locking mechanisms. We felt safe walking around the neighborhood. We also felt very safe with our son staying by himself at different levels (lobby, restaurant, terrace, room, etc.). Rooms: Each room had its own unique decoration and character. The rooms have spacious attached baths. Linen was changed every day and this included towels. The rooms and baths were clean. The triple room was rather small and would serve well as a double, as storage space and space for empty luggage were limited. The rooms have a mini-refrigerator that came in handy to store beverages and food, a coffee maker (we had no need to use it), a mini-TV (mostly receives channels that are in Turkish), and a hair dryer (a definite plus). Shampoo, bath gel and soap are provided in the bath. In addition, Mr. Kamil is there to answer any questions about travel around Istanbul or Turkey, help finalize travel plans, select restaurants, assist with local transportation (for example, R/T to Ataturk International Airport), and above all is a good conversationalist! Overall, an excellent value in a historic district of Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bookwormKettering
Reviews.Content: Clean room, very helpful and friendly staff, The breakfast room looked out over the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque. As we went with another couple it was great in the evenings to have two opulent sitting areas where we could chill out and discuss the days events over a glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Wife says thumbs down, husband says okay...”
Reviews.Author: budget81
Reviews.Content: Positives: Location: Very central, on a quiet side street. Very close to the Topkapi palace, Hagia Sofia, and Blue Mosque. You can the latter two from the rooftop terrace, which has an amazing view, as mentioned by other guests. Price: It's pretty cheap. Cleanliness: Both common areas and room were clean. Beds made daily, though fresh linen and towels only every other day. Stuff Works: TV and lights all in order, bathroom has plenty of hot water. Negative: DO NOT GET THE CHEAP ROOM. The light well rooms are, by wife's standards, nearly intolerable. Absolutely NO light at all. Very little fresh air, even with both "windows" open, because windows open into a dark little shaft. Totally claustrophobic. Unfortunately, only the light well rooms are cheap. Location puts you in the center of every cheesy, overpriced tourist trap in Istanbul. To get a decent meal without being ripped off, we were actually forced to walk at least a kilometer or two away. It's nice being near the sights but tough luck with food, and the night life is virtually nonexistent here. Noise: the hotel is NOISY. You can hear absolutely everything - people talking, going up stairs, etc. I am sure this effects the expensive rooms with windows as well as our cheap one.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ljufster
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan offers a great view of the Sea of Marmara, a quiet street and exceedingly close proximity to the Blue Mosque (2 blocks). Kamil, the owner and manager, is very pleasant, interesting and helpful, and he knows Istanbul very well. His staff are really decent people who tried to make our stay a good one, and they succeeded. Breakfast is served on the top floor with view of the sea, ships (and occasional dolphins!) and the hills of Istanbul, and the rooftop view has the Blue Mosque in one corner, the Aya Sofya in the other, and the sea taking up the rest.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Silvio_da_Milano
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan Park Hotel is located in Sultanahmet, very close to Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. I and my wife have been there during very cold days at the end of December 2008, and as we both had a flu, we spent many hours a day in the room. More than on other occasions, we have been very sensitive to the hotel conforts. Positive things of the hotel have been the courtesy of the hotel staff (they do everything they can for you), the room cleanliness, the good quality of the bed, the good heating system in the room, the facilities in the room (TV, minibar, coffee machine, wireless connection, hairdryer), the availability of a computer with internet connection in the hotel hall, the good choice at the breakfast buffet, the quietness of the area. On the less positive side, the room size was rather small, and the window sight was on the rear side, on very degraded buildings (the whole area is rather degraded, exception made for hotels, restaurants, bars and carpet shops). Although very clean, and with excellent hot water supply, the bath maintenance was questionable (broken tiles, leaking taps). The breakfast room had a breathtaking sight on the Bosphorus, but was rather cold, which is not very pleasant in winter time. The stairs were very narrow and sharp, so if you have a heavy luggage, you'll be in trouble (no elevator). In conclusion, this can be a recommendable hotel for friends, provided you can get a room on the front side (view on the sea), at floor 2 or 3. I'm not sure you can see the sea from the first floor. The hotel standard, according to my assessment, would be closer to 2 stars, rather than 3.

Reviews.Title: “one great little hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: asmallworld
Reviews.Content: While in Istanbul, we stayed at the Cosmopolitan Hotel in Istanbul. Located in the old city , it is less than 10 minutes by foot away from the city's major attractions. A small hotel, it had a very comfortable relaxed feeling... having a lounge area covered with gorgeous Turkish fabrics, carpets and coloured glass hanging lamps. Our room, overlooked the sea of Marmurar. Both day and night afforded breathtaking views. The rooms, although on the small side, were very comfortable and spotless. Typical Turkish breakfasts, were set out on the hotel's top floor overlooking the sea on one side and the Blue mosque on another. An outdoor patio was not in use when we were there but we did go to sit out one warm evening. I think what sets this charming hotel apart , was Kamil ( the owner). Almost always there, he willingly assisted and advised helping way beyond to make our trip a success ( in a city and country in which we spoke no Turkish).

Reviews.Title: “Grand Passion - N & L H - Melbourne/Australia”
Reviews.Author: pomegranate23
Reviews.Content: A lovely historical house turned into a wonderful boutique hotel. The Cosmopolitan Park Hotel is centrally located to many attractions. The rooms are very clean with great views over Bosphorus. It is tastefully decorated with traditional Turkish style with creative energy. In other words it bears all the hallmarks of an authentic traditional Turkish home. It is a sort of place people walk into and have a laugh. If you like to have a stress free zone from everyday life, I suggest you go up to the heavenly terrace and look out this spectacular views of the sea with a glass of wine in your hand. A lovely way to spend a lazy afternoon whilst the sun is brushing one's face. Kamil, the owner of the hotel who has a passion for wine, music, art and history has a small library. The Library has an agreeable broad cover of subject matter. You can also select a book from the shelves downstairs, in the sitting area and disappear in the autumn glorified lush cushions and comfortable armchairs. I particularly liked the ancient wooden cage, by the way. The neighbourhood is very safe for a late night stroll. There are full of great restaurants, galleries, cafes and shopping malls nearby. This neighbourhood is the hub of the food, music, arts and crafts scene. Through summer the place buzzes when people arrive from all over the world. There is so much is happening in the area. Well, one of the major airports is just thirty minutes away. While we were staying in Aug 2008, we enjoyed the modern amenities such as TV, split system cooling in each bedroom. The staff were very friendly and willing to answer any question. The service was excellent. Breakfast is self served with many choices and endless cups of coffee. I thoroughly enjoyed it. Many thanks to the management. One can experience this beautiful boutique hotel in a high level of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “The Canadian Group of 5”
Reviews.Author: KelownaBCGal
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to let you know about the wonderful time I had in Turkey this May. The hotel was comfortable and centrally located so that we could walk to see the sights, shop, have fun with the local people. The rooms are not big but they are clean, comfortable and beautifully decorated. One member of our group ordered a bedspread from the hotelâ€™s supplier and it was delivered the next day. I liked the fact that the Cosmopolitan has two computers set up so that you can send a quick note home and also research places in Turkey. Many evenings we would sit and just talk and laugh with Kamil. We also visited Kamilâ€™s brother Dogan at the Terrace Guest House. The Terrace is another great place to stay; if you get a chance to stay there ask for the top floor. You will have to walk up in both hotels but hey exercise is good. I enjoyed the fact that Kamil was able to give us great directions so we could venture out by bus and ferry to see more of this beautiful city. As FrancieP wrote, this wonderful man planned our trip down the west coast of Turkey for us in 2006. Many times we called Kamil and he would bail us out of our situation. If you are a lady traveller or are in need of advise you are in good hands here. The hotel offers a very good Turkish style breakfast of eggs, tomato, cucumber, bread, yogurt, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee (Nescafe:-),and tea. Now that I am home I sometimes treat myself to this just to get me back to Turkey, even found some Nescafe to make it more authentic!

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolitan Park a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Karuna8
Reviews.Content: I loved the Cosmpolitan Park Hotel. It Ä±s a wonderful place to stay wÄ±th fabulous furnishings and has a lovely relaxed atmosphere. The rooms are spacious and spotless. The view from the terrace is stunning - the Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara, and has a lovely feeling at night tÄ±me. The staff are wonderful and the Manager - Kamil has a wealth of knowledge both about Istanbul, Ottoman hÄ±story and much more. It Ä±s very central to all the fabulous sights in Sultanahmet too and the price is very good. I highly recommend this hotel. Karuna (Australia)
